sub_title: Master IT Project Manager, Scaled Agile Practice Consultant (SAFe SPC-T 6.0) and Published Author
summary: I'm an IPMA and PMI certified Master IT Project Manager and Lean-Agile Transformation Coach (SAFe SPC 6.0) with a passion for making your business and your IT successful. I have a Master's degree in Project Management and my thesis about the relationships between Project Marketing, Stakeholder Engagement and Project Success was published in the Journal of Modern Project Management.

awards.title: Freelancer of the Year Award - Category: ICT & Internet
awards.description:
I have been awarded the Freelancer of the Year Award for the ICT & Internet categor. This award has been given on the "Day of the Freelancer" on April 2nd 2016.

Over 10.000 freelancers competed in the Freelancer of the Year Awards, spread out over 10 categories. Based upon written reviews from former employers, managers and colleagues, a top 100 was established. The people in the top 100 were invited to record a pitch video, representing themselves, their company and their line of business. 

A shadow jury judged each pitch video and selected a top 3 for each category. The actual jury decided the winner of each category based on the written reviews, the pitch video and background research. Contestants were judged on several factors, like busness case, professional appearance, level of ambition and entrepeneurship. 

The personalized results from the jury have been combined in a report which can be provided upon request.

projects.title: SamWin & R.A.M.
projects.description:
SamWin
Uitvoering: Ter voorbereiding op de uitvoering van een strategisch programma moest de software die gebruikt werd door het contact center en door de service desk worden vervangen. Initieel gebruikte zij Peter Connects voor het aannemen en doorverbinden van telefoongesprekken. De mensen op het contact center werkten al 20 à 30 jaar met deze software, waardoor zij de verandering met argusogen bekeken. Ik heb hen gerustgesteld door met ze in gesprek te gaan om te begrijpen waar zij tegenop zagen en hoe zij hun werk deden. Vervolgens heb ik hen trainingen aangeboden waarin ik op een rustige en heldere manier het nieuwe systeem heb uitgelegd en henzelf de ruimte heb gegeven om met het nieuwe systeem te oefenen. Door ze tegelijkertijd goed te informeren over wat er zou veranderen en waarom dit moest gebeuren kon ik het vertrouwen opbouwen wat uiteindelijk geleid heeft tot een succesvolle migratie.

R.A.M.
Uitvoering: De afkorting van dit project staat voor “Rotterdamse Applicatie Migratie”. Alle applicaties die in Rotterdam actief waren moeten worden gemigreerd naar een nieuwe IT-infrastructuur. Het was echter nog niet duidelijk om welke applicaties dit ging en wie hiervoor verantwoordelijk was. Ik heb de applicatie inventarisatie geleid en een bijdrage aan geleverd. Op basis van het resultaat van deze inventarisatie heb ik een plan van aanpak opgesteld en daarin duidelijk aangegeven welke rollen hierbij betrokken moesten worden, welke rol welke verantwoordelijkheden zou hebben en in hoeverre er mensen beschikbaar waren binnen de organisatie om deze rollen invulling te geven. Op basis van dit plan is vervolgens het project gestart om de migraties daadwerkelijk uit te voeren.

contributors.headline: Master IT Project Manager, Scaled Agile Practice Consultant (SAFe SPC-T 6.0) and Published Author

projects.title: Streamliner
projects.description: In preparation of the implementation of a new financial system (OneStream) based on Microsoft Azure, I designed and implemented a new Cloud infrastructure. Before the start, 35 interfaces and a PowerCenter ETL environment for the sake of data transformation have been implemented. Consequently, new service management procedures to take care of this new system have been developed and implemented. This project was carried out in a politically charged surrounding, whereby I made sure there was an IT infrastructure available as soon as possible for the first Go Live. Furthermore, together with an Agile coach, we ensured an Agile way of working in a waterfall organization.

projects.title: Airpas Phase 2
projects.description: I designed a new infrastructure for the Airpas application and realized it in a new domain. The project was carried out in the Netherlands but managed from France. As a result, I often served as a liaison, balancing the forces, (political) influences, and interests of both the Dutch and the French stakeholders. Furthermore, I ensured a good mutual cohesion between all parties involved to realize a successful end result.

contributors.headline: Master IT Project Manager, Scaled Agile Practice Consultant (SAFe SPC-T 6.0) and Published Author

projects.title: Office automation Phase 1
projects.description:
Because of a considerable organizational change, I designed the implementation plan for the new office automation. Including the inventory and rationalization of the application landscape and realizing a design brief for a new Document Management System (DMS). 

Simultaneously with the project, half of the organization transferred to the CAK. Additionally, there was no Enterprise Architecture at the beginning of the project, nor was there an overview of the infrastructure, architecture, and of the applications and the application landscape, and insufficient description of all company processes.

To guarantee the project’s success, I put together a study group and a reflection group where all the departments and teams of the organisation were represented. I also contracted external parties to work together with the organisation on a Project Start Architecture for the new office automation and a design brief for the new DMS. Taking small steps, I took the organisation by the hand and developed the different products. This led to an implementation plan supported throughout the entire organization, which made it possible for Phase 2 of the project (the actual realization thereof) to begin.

contributors.headline: Master IT Project Manager, Scaled Agile Practice Consultant (SAFe SPC-T 6.0) and Published Author

projects.title: xRM Infrastructure
projects.description:
I designed, built, and granted management of the Microsoft Dynamics xRM, partly based on Cloud,
for the new Edison services of the four large municipalities: Amsterdam, Rotterdam, The Hague, and Utrecht. To guarantee the project’s success, at an early stage I sought after collaboration with the Application Development and the Business Development projects, which were carried out simultaneously by different project managers. I also had Microsoft involved to increase the success rate.

projects.title: GeCCo 2015
projects.description:
The Global eCollaboration Competition (GeCCo) is an international virtual 24-hour case study competition organized by IPMA Young Crew.

The world is going digital, which is why we have to be in the forefront of that wave in our networking, so we decided to organize an online competition that takes 24 hours, and teams in which each team member comes from a different country! With different time zones, 24 hours is almost as three days! Interested? You can be participating, organizing it locally or bring it to the international level!

profile_positions.title: Senior Information Technology Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
IPMA-C, PMP and PRINCE2 certified Master IT Project Manager, SAFe Program Consultant, Professional SCRUM Master and Product Owner. 

As a “seasoned” Project Manager and SAFe Agilist with more than 20 years of experience within the ICT sector, combined with a broad technical background, I have successfully completed many projects. I perform best in a workplace where creativity is required for (complex) migrations, and where new infrastructures must be designed and implemented. With my enthusing leadership, I can motivate people in an inspiring manner throughout the execution of the work and get them to perform even better. 

During the execution of projects, I know perfectly well how to navigate between technical IT work and the effect on the business. In doing so, I am a valued conversation partner for the customer in translating complex IT issues to “comprehensible Dutch or English”. My strong strategic knowledge and analytical skills help me identify problems and formulate action plans in a pragmatic way. Thanks to my methodical approach, I understand what is needed to manage projects successfully, both from a strategic as well as an operational perspective.

profile_positions.title: Senior Information Technology Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
During his time at Zorginstituut Nederland Jeffry managed the following projects:

1) Workspace innovation Phase 1:  Define a new Workspace concept which includes a new Document Management System and consolidates and rationalizes the application landscape. Create an implementation and migration strategy and define the needed resources, total cost and time needed for the design, build and realization phases of this new Workspace concept. 

2) Enterprise Architecture: Realisation and implementation of the Enterprise Architecture.

3) Culture Change: Realisation of a Plan of Approach for the projectstream Culture Change within the Program “Samen Beslissen”.

4) Portfolio Management System: Gathering of functional requirements, execution of application selection and ensuring approval of the Board of Directors for a new Portfolio Management System.

5) IT Process Improvement: Enhancement of IT processes and definition and implementation of new processes such as Apllication Lifecycle Management.
profile_positions.title: Senior Information Technology Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Project: xRM Infrastructure

Goal: Building the foundation for the new Professional Portal for the "G4"*, based on Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2015, using the Cloud (Microsoft Azure) and expanding the twin datacenter concept with new hardware and technology like always on high available clustering techniques.

Detail: Design, build and implement a high available  OTAP street for CRM, extended with Demo, Training and Analysis environments. 

Cooperation: To ensure the Success of this project, we work in close cooperation with the Application Decelopment project and the Business Development project, which are run simultaneously by different PM's. Also, we are working together with Microsoft on this to further ensure Success. 

Challenge: Microsoft Dynamics CRM is not yet in use by Wigo4it or the G4, meaning that we are defining and implementing a whole new service
portfolio for them. Also, we are implementing the first SQL Always On clusters at Wigo4it to provide high availability of the xRM platform. The System Administrators have been attending courses and are currently being trained on the job by the project, to ensure the platform can be sufficiently supported after Go Live. 

*G4 = The 4 larger municipalities in The Netherlands, consisting of Amsterdam, Rotterdam, The Hague and Utrecht.
profile_positions.title: Senior Information Technology Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Jeffry managed the following projects: 

1) Project AMUSE: Application Migration and phasing oUt SErvers - The project was started to ensure all Windows Server 2003 servers (220+) in use by IT Heineken Nederland were shutdown before the end of support date. To achieve this goal, all applications (100+) and (file share) data had to be migrated to servers with an Operating System of a higher version. 

2) CRM Dynamics 2013: Design and implement a Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2013 environment and lead the transition of several Business Units from the CRM 2011 platform to the CRM 2013 platform, including the development and roll out of Surface tablets and the CRM app.
profile_positions.title: Senior Information Technology Project Manager
